author: News On February
title: I thought I was going to die : Hero chef tried to use kickboxing skills to save woman from knifeman - Yahoo7
text:
"I kicked him on the face and on his mouth and he didn't fall down, because he's actually, he's a big boy."The offender retaliated by stabbing Mr Spina in the stomach.The attack happened quickly, and in moments the offender ran off along Yarra Promenade, while the victim approached a nearby parking attendant for help."I didn't even feel when the knife coming through my skin," Mr Spina said. Police have released two images of Kenny Scarlett in the hope that someone may recognise him and provide information on his current whereabouts. Pictures: Victoria Police Police have reviewed CCTV of the incident and released images today of Kenneth "Kenny" Scarlett, whom they believe was the man responsible.The stabbing victim said he will always struggle to comprehend why someone would resort to such unnecessary violence. "The world doesn't need these kind of people." The victim, who remains in a stable condition, said he hoped the police will track down the person responsible soon, before he hurt someone else. Police investigate at the scene of the vicious Friday night stabbing attack on Melbourne's Yarra Promenade, outside the Crown Casino. Picture: 7 News The chef only arrived in Melbourne a few weeks ago, but despite his near death experience, he said there were no hard feelings and would be staying a little longer. Police have released two images of Scarlett in the hope that someone may recognise him and provide information on his current whereabouts. He is described as of Caucasian in appearance, with a solid build, about 180cm tall, with short light brown hair and brown eyes. Scarlett is known to use public transport and frequent the Mill Park and Heidelberg areas, north of Melbourne. Detectives are also hoping to speak with the woman and two other men believed to be assaulted prior to the stabbing. Anyone with information is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers 1800 333 000 or use the Crime Stoppers online reporting page .
